climbs.name: Scaling the Scalene
climbs.fa: ? I know someone has done this

content.description: This climbs the north face of Triangle Boulder. Start on the low, flaky jugs, and work slightly up and right to follow feet. Make crux moves back left through and slopey pocket and slopey edge to reach up and left to a good, right-facing gaston/sidepull. Continue to work left through more sidepulls avoiding either arete until the very top and the topout.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spotter.

content.description: This is an easy face climb on the south side of the boulder. I am definitely not the first person to play on this but thought since the area was the Triangle Boulder Area, the Triangle Boulder should be posted. If you've got info, let me know and I'll fix what needs to be fixed.
content.location: Start right in the center and climb up. The downclimb is on the west side slope.

content.description: This problem just traverses around the lower section of the boulder. I suppose you could start anywhere and go around. We were starting on the southwest corner and moving around. The northeast corner is the crux if you're staying low.

Climb the north side of the boulder's northeast arete.

Starting from a sit adds a bit of awkwardness and maybe a grade (V2) in difficulty. The stand flows better and climbs around a V1.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's northeast arete.
